ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt so much in this course about making a movie form readings, evaluating scripts, writing and directing. The support and attention from the professor and class is above and beyond any other course Ive had at Yale.
I learned how much work and planning must go into a film, as well as received invaluable feedback on my writing from Professor Andrews and my peers as well.
I learned how to write, direct, and produce my senior thesis film. Many of the insights and knowledge I gained were from my own oopsies.
I became a filmmaker through this class. I learned so much about filmmaking, the art of film, film history, and much more through our class discussions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: a lot of time to workshop your own work, creative freedom to explore interests, small setting, incredible professor who goes above and beyond to give feedback and support our filmmaking in any way he can

Strengths: Jon Andrews IS Yale film production. One of the kindest professors I've had and certainly the most understanding.
Weaknesses: With as many students enrolled, fighting for resources (crew, equipment, ...)  was not fun.
Some additional structure would be nice but with the crapshoot of a year we had with the school's policies that's almost unfair to say.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to make films, working with Jon Andrews in this class is where you should do it.

I would definitely recommend this course to any filmmaker. It is a great help in terms of support, and will help keep you on schedule. It will also provide you with ample feedback to improve the quality of work.
This is the senior req so if you're taking it, you're taking it. That said, I will rave about how wonderful of a professor Jon is.
I would recommend. If not for the filmmaking knowledge, do it to learn under Professor Jonathan Andrews.
